remarks: A set of words having the length of a given word increased by 1 contains a unique word with the given word as prefix if there is a unique symbol which extends the given word to be a word of the set.  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 6-Oct-2018.)
statement:
reuccats1 $p |- ( ( W e. Word V /\ A. x e. X ( x e. Word V /\ ( # ` x ) = ( ( # ` W ) + 1 ) ) ) -> ( E! v e. V ( W ++ <" v "> ) e. X -> E! x e. X W = ( x substr <. 0 , ( # ` W ) >. ) ) ) $.
$d V v x $.
$d W v x $.
$d X v x $.
